title: Federal Employee Systematic Targeting and Schedule F Implementation Network
description: Research systematic targeting of federal employees through Schedule F reclassification and coordinated loyalty purge operations from TTT analysis.
focus_areas: Schedule F executive order implementation timeline and agency coordination
Federal employee termination patterns by agency and political alignment
Loyalty test mechanisms and screening process implementation
Career staff replacement with political appointee coordination
Agency-specific purge operations and systematic targeting
Union representative targeting and labor rights violations
Security clearance manipulation for political compliance
methodology: Document Schedule F implementation across executive agencies
Track federal employee termination patterns and political timing
Map loyalty screening implementation and coordination mechanisms
Identify systematic career staff replacement operations
Cross-reference union targeting with broader anti-labor coordination
source_analysis: Based on analysis of 20 TTT articles documenting systematic federal employee targeting including Schedule F implementation, loyalty purges, and career staff replacement.
research_context: TTT analysis revealed extensive civil service capture operations requiring timeline documentation
